intro: Indosasa parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved indosasa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial with simple, alternate leaves that are usually small and ovate. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along streambanks.
